title: Analysis
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

data <- read.csv("players_in_chess.csv")

data <- data[order(data$rating, decreasing = TRUE),]


# data


data2 <- head(data, n = 10)

graphic1 <- ggplot(data2, mapping = aes(x = reorder(name, -rating) , y = rating , fill = country)) + 
  geom_col()  
graphic1+
  labs(
    title = "Plaers and Ratihgs",
    subtitle = "Per Country",
    x = "Name",
    y = "Rating"
  ) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))









data3 <- head(data, n = 100)




graphic2 <- ggplot(data3, mapping = aes(x = reorder(country, -rating) , fill = country)) + 
  geom_histogram(stat="count", linewidth = 0.5)  

Warning in geom_histogram(stat = "count", linewidth = 0.5): Ignoring unknown
parameters: `binwidth`, `bins`, and `pad`

graphic2+
  labs(
    title = "",
    subtitle = "Per Country",
    x = "Name",
    y = "Frequency"
  ) +
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))    









data4<- data %>%
filter(country == c("India"))




graphic3 <- ggplot(data4, mapping = aes(x = name  , y = rating , fill = country)) + 
 geom_density( linewidth = 0.5)  


graphic3+
  labs(
    title = "",
    subtitle = "Per Country",
    x = "Name",
    y = "Frequency"
  )

title: My Cool Plot
text:
── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.4     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



diamonds |> 
  filter(z != 0) |> 
  filter(color == "D") |> 
  ggplot(aes(x = carat, y = price, color = cut)) + 
    geom_point() +
    scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::dollar) +
    labs(title = "Prices and Sizes for Diamonds of Color D",
         subtitle = "'Round' carat values like 1, 1.5 and 2 are more common.",
         x = "Carat",
         y = "Price")









#| echo: false

#| label: setup
